Description: Fragments of upper part of situla, reconstructed. A, lion; B, goat, an incised rosette within the curve of its horn. The paint has mostly vanished, but there are traces of purple on the belly of the lion and alternate petals of the rosette.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 19
Curator's comments: The fragment with the hind legs of the goat does not join, but is probably from the same pot = BM GR 1888,0208.23
Findspot number 19 is pencilled on the item.
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 602, 3-4 (and Pl. GB 597, 7 and 14)) (Group C10)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 250)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.208)
